definition: to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time

sentences.english: This thy self-separation has taken body in me.
sentences.chinese: 你這分身已在我體內成形。

sentences.chinese: 因而想與夢只是神在夢覺的不同狀態下的分身。

sentences.english: This photo demonstrates the hollow, void-like quality of Fen Shen.
sentences.chinese: 這張相片示範分身空心，像虛無的空性。

sentences.english: His body without shame, know heart every time.
sentences.chinese: 安分身無辱，知幾心逢閒。

sentences.english: Whereas divide time whether the idea gets into little, the strength then is extra opposite than to must be a mini bit weak.
sentences.chinese: 反之分身如果念頭進入得少，力量則相對於要弱一些。

sentences.english: "Fen Shen" is akin to the concept of "Logos" – the Word - expounded in biblical positivism.
sentences.chinese: 分身猶如聖經實證主義中的邏各斯。

sentences.english: Men often get fidgety or irritable when they’re supposed to be in two places at once.
sentences.chinese: 男人感到分身乏術時往往會煩躁憤怒。

sentences.english: We cannot be here now…and also be everywhere at once.
sentences.chinese: 此路不通，而且我們同時還分身乏術。
